item.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for
item.description: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

item.title: Endemic frog and gecko species identified on Dauan Island in Torres Strait
item.description: Two new frog species and a banded-patterned gecko are believed to have sheltered among the boulders of Dauan, in the Torres Strait, for millions of years.

item.title: Video released of moments leading up to strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights
item.description: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal woman’s human rights.

item.title: Wayne Swan steps down as Labor president urging party to focus on membership boost
item.description: Labor party president Wayne Swan will step down next July and has warned the ALP must boost membership if it is to survive into the future.

item.title: Wittenoom asbestos contamination prompts legal threat from Banjima traditional owners
item.description: After decades of disconnection, the traditional owners of Wittenoom say they are prepared to take legal action to ensure the area is properly remediated so they can return to country.

item.title: Friday the pelican captured and washed after three-week chase
item.description: Friday the pelican evaded capture for weeks. But a long-overdue bath is for her own good.

item.title: Strict conditions imposed on future LIV Golf site at North Adelaide
item.description: South Australia's Aboriginal affairs minister has imposed 31 strict conditions on the government's planned redevelopment of the North Adelaide golf course.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Scott Boland bowls Victoria to Sheffield Shield victory over NSW, ahead of Ashes against England
item.description: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Family of woman murdered by co-worker at National Zoo tell court of their 'constant grief'
item.description: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

item.title: Premier David Crisafulli apologises for 'poor choice' comment about Melbourne stabbing attack
item.description: David Crisafulli apologises for a remark about crime, made on the same day footage emerges of a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat New Zealand Silver Ferns 69-52 in game one of Constellation Cup
item.description: Australia has stormed to a commanding win in the first Test of the Constellation Cup series, defeating New Zealand 69-52.

item.title: AFLW Round 10: Port Adelaide Power defeat Hawthorn Hawks, West Coast Eagles down Geelong Cats
item.description: Port Adelaide defeats Hawthorn to record its fourth win of the AFLW season, while West Coast moves closer to a maiden finals appearance with victory over Geelong.

item.title: Adelaide United defeats Sydney FC 2-1, Brisbane downs Macarthur on A-League Men opening night
item.description: Adelaide United begins its season with a 2-1 win over Sydney, while Brisbane coach Michael Valkanis sees son Dimitri sent off in the Roar's 1-0 defeat of Macarthur.

item.title: Albanese's Trump meeting comes amid global geopolitical circus
item.description: All signs suggest Anthony Albanese will be sticking with Plan A in his meeting with the US president on Tuesday, rather than becoming a prop for the bigger global circus.

item.title: Creating deepfakes has never been easier, so what should parents do?
item.description: Some parents may feel distressed and ill-equipped to tackle the issue of image-based abuse and deepfakes. This is what to watch out for.

item.title: Video appears to show March for Australia organiser coordinating with Neo-Nazi
item.description: A previously unreported video has emerged appearing to show a key March for Australia organiser coordinating with a Neo-Nazi at the first rally in Sydney in August, ABC NEWS Verify has found.

item.title: Administrative Review Tribunal swamped by surging demand, more than 100 members short
item.description: The Administrative Review Tribunal was set up to resolve issues with its predecessor, but has struggled with staffing and long wait times over its first year.

item.title: Education department admits not enough done to stop Dubbo College Delroy aide harming children
item.description: The NSW government says it should have taken allegations of wrongdoing by a male school staff member more seriously. That failure left those who reported it so isolated their mental health spiralled and never fully recovered.

item.title: Wall Street sell-off could mean hip-pocket relief for millions of Australians
item.description: Australia's big insurance companies were sold off heavily on the share market on Friday after a wave of anxiety hit the sector.

item.title: Donald Trump's family reportedly made hundreds of millions from crypto after White House return
item.description: US President Donald Trump and his family have reportedly amassed hundreds of millions of dollars from cryptocurrencies. Here is what we know.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou defends record as pressure builds at Nottingham Forest
item.description: Amid growing pressure of his poor start at Nottingham Forest, Ange Postecoglou delivers a five-minute defence of his record as a manager.

item.title: Fire authorities warn of 'above average' fire season as NSW starts to warm up
item.description: Fire authorities warn of above average fire season in NSW despite previous modelling showing a wet summer.

item.title: Brad Battin under pressure as Liberal MPs weigh up second leadership spill in less than 12 months
item.description: The Victorian Liberals could be headed for their third leader in less than 12 months, with MPs internally dissatisfied with the performance of current leader Brad Battin.

item.title: Is the transfer of Australia's best young soccer players a good thing?
item.description: Are A-League soccer fans right to be frustrated when its best young players are sold off, or should they accept it is a 'selling' league?

item.title: As the Australian op shop turns 100, the legacy of Lady Millie Tallis lives on
item.description: One hundred years ago, showgirl-turned-philanthropist Millie Tallis spent weeks preparing for a major second-hand goods fundraiser in Melbourne, giving rise to the Australian op shop.

item.title: Young people with chronic pain feel 'unheard', misunderstood
item.description: Chronic pain affects one in five Australian children. Two young people who experience it want more people to understand their conditions and better support for all children in pain.

item.title: Lack of housing in remote NT community Borroloola forcing families off country
item.description: Remote NT residents are calling on the government to fund new housing in the Gulf community of Borroloola, fearing limited access to appropriate homes has forced families to move off country.

item.title: A few simple questions reveal the games adults aren't brave enough to play
item.description: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.

item.title: Australians encouraged to have conversations about end-of-life care as new online tool launched
item.description: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

item.title: James Duckworth returns to ATP Tour semifinal four years after his last
item.description: Four years since he last reached an ATP tournament semifinal in Kazakhstan, Australian James Duckworth is back in the last four at the Almaty Open

item.title: Hospital in the Home program helping young man with agoraphobia who 'cut himself off from the world'
item.description: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

item.title: The face of Brisbane is changing — but should thousands of homes be developed in a flood zone?
item.description: Plans to build a riverfront precinct in a flood-prone area of Brisbane have urban planners and locals wary.

item.title: Tool's Maynard James Keenan on touring Australia, making wine and martial arts
item.description: The alt-metal band's frontman is a world-class multi-tasker. He tells us how he balances it all.

item.title: Western Australia starts harvesting what could be a record-breaking grain crop
item.description: Farmers in Western Australia have begun harvesting a grain crop that could set a new record. It is a different story on the other side of the Nullabor though.

item.title: Greek-inspired lamb kebabs with olive potatoes baked in the oven - ABC News
item.description: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

item.title: From a Springsteen biopic to a doggy horror: here are the movies out in October
item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.title: North Melbourne's record-setting AFLW winning streak is clear in the numbers
item.description: Having developed the program layer by layer since joining the AFLW in 2019, North Melbourne's disciplined, professional style of footy is forcing the rest of the league to rise to their level.

item.title: Cool weather prescribed burn on WA's south coast should be expanded, environmental group says
item.description: The success of a small, autumn prescribed burn on WA's south coast has prompted calls to replace the regular program to reduce environmental damage.

item.title: NT's top judge tells government not to interfere with court independence, in leaked email
item.description: A leaked email shows the Northern Territory's highest-ranking judge wrote to a government department asking it not to interfere with the Supreme Court's independence. A courts spokesperson has since said the email was the result of a misunderstanding.

item.title: Phoebe Litchfield learning from opening partner Alyssa Healy at Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: Alyssa Healy has joined an elite band of women batters with 7,000 international runs, and Australia's captain is giving her brilliant young opening partner something to aim for.

item.title: Minister flags compulsory voting in local government elections, 4-year terms amid low voter turnout
item.description: Voting in council elections could become mandatory in Western Australia if the turnout for this weekend's poll continues to plummet, the local government minister warns.

item.title: Heavy horsemen keep farming traditions alive
item.description: Aleks Berzins is farming the land in the same way his grandfather did, using draught horses for jobs now widely done by machines.

item.title: Gulgong woman changes career to honour murder victim Michelle Bright
item.description: The murder of Michelle Bright altered Abby-Lee Honeysett's childhood in Gulgong, New South Wales and guided her towards a career in forensic medicine.

item.title: A history of the Israeli settler movement in the Occupied Palestinian Territory
item.description: Since October 7, tensions have been rising between Palestinians and Israeli settlers in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.

item.title: Gungahlin United Football Club to fold after losing NPL licence, leaving 2,000 grassroots players club-less
item.description: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

item.title: Shohei Ohtani dominates to send Dodgers through to World Series after defeating Brewers
item.description: Shohei Ohtani propels the Los Angeles Dodgers back to the World Series with a two-way performance for the ages to clinch the National League Championship.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce hasn't quit the Nationals yet but he's got one foot out the door
item.description: In declaring he won't be recontesting his lower house seat and letting speculation run that he might jump ship for One Nation, Barnaby Joyce is declaring he's had enough with the Nationals under David Littleproud.

item.title: Kangaroos defeat Crows by 40 points to move closer to winning record as Saints, Dockers and Demons notch victories
item.description: North Melbourne moves one victory away from equalling the all-time VFL/AFL and AFLW winning record with a 40-point drubbing of Adelaide as St Kilda moves closer to a maiden finals appearance.

item.title: NT chief minister claims tough-on-crime approach has led to 'significant' crime drop
item.description: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

item.title: Chinese Communist Party's Central Committee set for major shake-up at plenum meeting
item.description: A key meeting of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee is expected to include a major shake-up of President Xi Jinping's inner circle.

item.title: Collingwood cult hero Mason Cox not offered new contract for 2026 AFL season
item.description: Mason Cox, the first American to become an AFL regular, confirms he will not be with the Magpies in 2026.

item.title: Jamie Melham creates Caulfield Cup history after riding Half Yours to victory
item.description: Jamie Melham breaks new ground as the first female jockey to win the Caulfield Cup in its 149-year history, steering favourite Half Yours to victory in the $5 million handicap.

item.title: Nottingham Forest sack manager Ange Postecoglou immediately after loss to Chelsea
item.description: Nottingham Forest sacked the winless manager moments after their 3-0 defeat by Chelsea on Saturday local time, which left the club 17th in the standings and on the brink of slipping into the relegation zone.

item.title: China's economic slowdown has become its diplomatic weapon in the Pacific
item.description: For Australia and the US, the Pacific is no longer a comfortable backyard — it's a battleground of credibility.

item.title: The deep Indigenous history of Australia deserves to be up in lights
item.description: We've flipped the script to put Indigenous Australians back at the centre of telling their own stories.

item.title: Prince Andrew's decision to give up his titles may have been quietly orchestrated by members of his own family
item.description: With the swirl of news around Prince Andrew this week, something had to be done; the question was whether he would do it himself or if his brother would be forced to show him the door.

item.title: BOM's first long-range summer forecast shows increased chance of extreme heat
item.description: Hot nights coupled with high daytime temperatures could see Australia heading into an extremely hot summer, BOM's first long-range forecast indicates.

item.title: Native mussel restoration project supported by Victor Harbor community
item.description: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

item.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
item.description: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

item.title: How Mother Teresa helped Steve Waugh channel his 'power' for children in need
item.description: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

item.title: 'Gellung Warl' and other Victorian Aboriginal words that are part of Australia's first Treaty
item.description: Victoria's first Treaty with First Peoples' was debated in state parliament last week. The Treaty introduces some Victorian Aboriginal words you may not have heard before — here's how to say them and what they mean.

item.title: Aussie Bird Count brings together students, photographers and nature-lovers
item.description: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round two quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne confirms form ahead of Ashes, Scott Boland bullies and spinners offer reminder
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne's magical early season form continues with the bat, Scott Boland and a pair of spinners offer a reminder of their skill, while Sam Konstas turns on the flair at round two of the Sheffield Shield.

item.title: Iconic house for sale for only second time in 193-year history
item.description: Classical musicians Richard and Suzy Miller count their circa-1832 home as one of their greatest creative achievements as they prepare to leave it for someone else to love.

item.title: James Duckworth falls at Almaty Open semi-final stage against Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Australian seed-slayer James Duckworth has finally met his match in Almaty, where Daniil Medvedev dug deep to beat him in three sets.

item.title: North Queensland by-election to provide snapshot of state's politics a year on from LNP victory
item.description: The looming by-election in Hinchinbrook will not have a significant impact on the makeup of Queensland parliament, but it will give insight into the state of play of politics a year after the LNP swept to power.

item.title: It's been called Canberra's 'forever government' — but ACT Labor's brand is growing tired
item.description: It's been a year since Canberrans re-elected an ACT Labor government for a seventh consecutive term — but as budget pressures bite, analysts say Labor's stocks are suffering from brand fatigue.

item.title: Mike Hewson creates controversial children's playgrounds. Explore his latest creation
item.description: This designer's "risky playgrounds" are often divisive. His latest is four storeys underground in a former World War II oil tank.

item.title: New Tasmanian Integrity Commission head will decide whether to release report from six-year investigation
item.description: Seven years after allegations were made against a practitioner who was allegedly misusing public resources, Tasmania's Integrity Commission has finalised its investigation into the matter. However, the report has not been released to the public.

item.title: Social media promotion of raw milk 'misleading and dangerous'
item.description: A public health expert says social media content creators are undermining years of scientific research by promoting raw milk.

item.title: GPs with extra skills who want to work in Tasmania say there are no suitable jobs
item.description: Rural generalists are GPs with training in emergency care and one other advanced skill area. While Tasmania has a training program for rural generalists, doctors say their skills are not properly recognised by the Tasmanian Health Service.

item.title: International chefs share signature flavours as part of Lambassador program
item.description: A delegation of international chefs from 11 countries have landed in Australia to gain a deeper understanding of locally produced Australian lamb.

item.title: Nationals leader wants Barnaby Joyce to 'stay', amid rumour of One Nation defection
item.description: Announcing he would not re-contest his seat of New England for the Nationals, Barnaby Joyce cited an irreparable breakdown with his party leader David Littleproud. Mr Littleproud says he still wants Mr Joyce to stay.

item.title: De Havilland Vampire Mk35A jet fighter to be restored by Dareton Men's Shed
item.description: A former RAAF jet fighter will be rebuilt by an amateur team of restorers in the second such project for a south-west New South Wales men's shed.

item.title: National Disruption Group to be established to crush tobacco black market
item.description: A new "National Disruption Group" will be convened to stamp out the exploding illicit tobacco market and other "converging" threats, the home affairs minister has announced.

item.title: Five suspected rat poison cases detected in south-east Queensland
item.description: Queensland Health is investigating after five people were hospitalised with symptoms of ingesting rat poison.

item.title: Australia's worst peacetime aviation disaster memorialised on 75th anniversary
item.description: A memorial, including a replica of the aircraft and a plaque made out of a stone recovered from the crash site, has been unveiled in York.

item.title: Committed band of skateboarders trying to preserve Fremantle's best spots
item.description: WA's bustling port city of Fremantle is changing, and in between a swathe of redevelopment stands a persistent, dedicated and vocal group experiencing some mixed results — the skateboarding community.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou's Nottingham Forest stint a classic case of wrong place, wrong time
item.description: Ange Postecoglou was on a hiding to nothing at Nottingham Forest, his sacking the result of terrible recruitment and a knee-jerk appointment.

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to immediate ceasefire after peace talks in Doha
item.description: A week of fierce border clashes has seen the worst violence between the two countries since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in 2021.

item.title: 'Green bans' saved Sydney's historic buildings and taught economists a lesson
item.description: The "green bans" in the 1970s saved many of Australia's historic buildings and our cities are richer for them. But a famous economist didn't like them.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins the Top 100 Books countdown — as it happened
item.description: Trent Dalton's debut novel Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st Century countdown.

item.title: How Claire's decision to be 'one and done' was rocked by divorce
item.description: After a traumatic birth, followed by mental and physical health challenges, Claire was "one and done". But divorce made her think twice about her decision.

item.title: Tiger snake slides over passenger's foot during a drive on NSW far south coast
item.description: A passenger in a car has the fright of his life when a tiger snake slithers across his feet during a drive on the NSW far south coast.

item.title: North Adelaide golf course safeguards fall short, some Kaurna community members say
item.description: As the Malinauskas government proceeds with its $50 million North Adelaide golf course upgrade, some Kaurna elders are grappling with the prospect that the redevelopment could uncover Aboriginal remains.

item.title: The story of the 1970 West Gate Bridge disaster features in Melbourne Theatre Company's 2026 season
item.description: The people impacted by Australia's worst industrial disaster are at the centre of West Gate by Dennis McIntosh, one of seven new Australian plays coming to Melbourne Theatre Company in 2026.

item.title: Bruce Reynolds to remain City of Perth Lord Mayor as counting continues in WA local government elections
item.description: Bruce Reynolds has held onto the title of City of Perth Lord Mayor, while early figures from WA's local government elections show voter turnout is below what authorities hoped for.

item.title: Wadeye traditional owners say Yidiyi cultural festival brings community together as 'one family'
item.description: Traditional owners of the remote NT Aboriginal community of Wadeye say the community has been brought "together as one family" at this year's Yidiyi cultural festival.

item.title: Bulldogs keep finals hopes alive with 66-point Suns trouncing, Lions and Tigers pick up wins
item.description: The Western Bulldogs hammer Gold Coast by 66 points to keep their finals flame flickering, while Brisbane returns to the top four with victory over Essendon.

item.title: Possible space junk found near Western Australian mine site
item.description: Suspected space debris is believed to have crashed near a WA mine site, with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau confirming the object was not from a commercial aircraft.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The results are in — Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's inaugural Top 100 Books of the 21st Century.

item.title: Australia cruises to seven-wicket victory over India in rain-shortened ODI
item.description: Surviving a series of rain delays in Perth, Australia records a seven-wicket win over India in the first of three men's ODI matches.

item.title: If AI and crypto aren't bubbles, we could be in big trouble
item.description: Speculative manias where the first investors win because there isn't a bust are rare occurrences.

item.title: Reused signature among string of issues as home owner left with unfinished build
item.description: When Matthew Mapley questioned why the bank had paid his builder for unfinished works, it said it had his written authority — except he hadn't signed it.

item.title: How much do you know about Australia's epic 65,000-year history?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How much do you really know about Australia's epic 65,000-year history?
item.description: First Nations people have survived and thrived through an ice age and massive landscape changes — as well as sharing the land with giant animals.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce says One Nation 'not barking mad' on net zero, but will not reveal if he will defect
item.description: Barnaby Joyce says that, "unlike others", One Nation's approach to climate change is not "barking mad". But the Nationals MP says he remains with his party — for now.

item.title: Anthony Albanese's meeting with Donald Trump could hardly be timed better
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is about to set foot inside the gilded cage of the Oval Office — and the timing could hardly be better.

item.title: Olympic BMX champion Saya Sakakibara still fears racing after brother Kai's horrific crash
item.description: When Saya Sakakibara saw her brother nearly die in a BMX crash, fear took hold. It nearly broke the star siblings' Olympic dream.

item.title: Over a dozen unis are using AI to catch AI — and getting it wrong
item.description: At least a dozen Australian universities are using AI to detect AI. But they're not always catching cheats. Instead, they're wrongly accusing students of academic misconduct.

item.title: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto has just marked one year in office. Here is what has happened
item.description: A year after Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto won the election, the families of Indonesians arrested in recent protests are expressing dissatisfaction with his leadership.

item.title: Teenager who died by suicide sent final message to Gold Coast health service, but it went unanswered
item.description: The ABC has uncovered the case as part of an examination of Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service's treatment of mental health patients and their suicides.

item.title: Rabbit populations boom in parts of Australia as ideal conditions see pests return
item.description: A resurgence of rabbit populations following recent rainfall is driving experts to urge for increased control measures.

item.title: Daniil Medvedev wins Almaty Open, Elena Rybakina closes in on WTA Finals
item.description: Daniil Medvedev claims his first ATP Tour tournament win since 2023, while Elena Rybakina's push to reach the WTA Finals gathers momentum.

item.title: ASX closes higher supported by banks while gold stocks sold off, China's economy continues to slow — as it happened
item.description: The ASX gained 0.4 per cent as investors rotated out of miners and gold and into banks.

item.title: All the numbers behind Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The winner for the Top 100 Books has been announced. What do the votes behind it say about us?

item.title: Millions being spent as Australia prepares for deadly H5 strain of bird flu
item.description: The bird flu outbreak that saw millions of chickens culled and a national shortage of eggs has been declared eradicated, but scientists warn a much deadlier strain of avian influenza could arrive this spring.

item.title: Healthscope under fire over proposal to farm millions in employees' tax benefits
item.description: In-receivership hospital group Healthscope is taking radical steps to stay alive, converting to a charity and proposing to take up to 90 per cent of a benefit intended to reduce workers' taxable income.

item.title: Multiple sclerosis support group tries to fill gaps as Northern Territory services dwindle
item.description: Being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis can often be an isolating experience, and even more so for those in Darwin who lack access to on-the-ground supports. Despite these barriers, a group of local women have created a support group to help fill the service gap.

item.title: Drone footage reveals Gaza City's destruction as people return home during ceasefire
item.description: One week into the ceasefire in Gaza, Palestinians are returning to destroyed homes and trying to find shelter.

item.title: England records four-run Women's World Cup win over India to join Australia in semifinals
item.description: England secures its Women's World Cup semifinal spot with a tense four-run win over tournament co-host India at Indor's Holkar Stadium.

item.title: Tourism dollars roll into Carnamah a year after arrival of big tractor
item.description: One year on from its opening, the orange icon has brought people from all over Australia — and the world — to WA's Midwest.

item.title: India backs Virat Kohli to rebound after ODI duck against Australia in Perth series opener
item.description: Virat Kohli failed to score in the opening men's ODI in Perth. However, his India teammates expect their ex-skipper to quickly recapture his best form.

item.title: Holiday from Hospital virtual reality to transport patients to Australia's north-west
item.description: A leukaemia survivor designs a VR program that will help patients travel to some of Australia's iconic locations from their hospital beds.

item.title: Richmond is starting to play good footy. But in AFLW's short season there's no time left to build momentum
item.description: After a 0-7 start to the season, Richmond are starting to notch wins on the board. But it's too late for much momentum to build in the short women's season.

item.title: Some scientists challenge logic of Victoria's fuel reduction burns
item.description: Dry winter conditions have resulted in extra fuel reduction burns in regional Victoria ahead of the fire season. But some scientists are asking if fuel burns are the best way to reduce fire risk.

item.title: Severe winds and hail hit WA's Kimberley as wet season approaches
item.description: Wild weather hit the Kimberley over the weekend, with some residents witnessing hail falling on their lawns despite it being a 38-degree day.

item.title: F1 standings: Oscar Piastri says too early for McLaren to prioritise drivers as Max Verstappen continues charge
item.description: Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren does not need to prioritise one driver over the other, as four-time world champion Max Verstappen continues to narrow the deficit to both.

item.title: Warning over rare but deadly virus after bat bites Pilbara woman
item.description: A Pilbara resident says an attempt to save a small bat stuck in her house has resulted in painful treatment for a deadly virus that can be passed onto humans.

item.title: Melt Festival is giving queer artists a space to be themselves
item.description: Brisbane's Melt Festival has rapidly expanded in the past decade, inviting numerous venues into the celebration of queer artistry.

item.title: Sam Kerr backed by Matildas coach Joe Montemurro to make impact in friendlies
item.description: Sam Kerr will return to the Matildas fold off the back of limited minutes at Chelsea, but coach Joe Montemurro is confident she will shine.

item.title: Mossman sugarcane industry on its last legs as haulage deal ends
item.description: A deal between Mossman sugarcane growers and a mill 100 kilometres away has been deemed unviable, leaving farmers without a place to send their product after this season.

item.title: What we know about the Louvre jewellery heist
item.description: Here are the details on the items stolen in the Louvre heist that unfolded in broad daylight in Paris.

item.title: Cargo plane slides off runway in Hong Kong killing two airport staff
item.description: The flight arriving from Dubai was landing at Hong Kong International Airport when it skidded off the runway, leading to the deaths of two men in a vehicle on the ground, according to police.

item.title: Deep Time, a story 65,000 years in the making
item.description: ABC's Story Lab team has created an interactive tool to help Australians better understand the ancient history of our continent and its First Nations peoples. Look back at our blog to see how it works.

item.title: Black Swans rowing crew from WA records win at Head of the Charles Regatta in Boston
item.description: A group of West Australian former high-level rowers are still in shock after claiming a win at the world's biggest and most famous rowing event — The Head of the Charles Regatta in Boston.

item.title: Samoa down to 17 fit players after Pacific Championships loss to New Zealand
item.description: Samoa's brutal loss to New Zealand leaves them needing to call fresh troops into their squad, with the Pacific powerhouse down to just 17 fit players.

item.title: Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner sues senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price over defamation claims
item.description: A seven-day Federal Court defamation case, alleging senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price "trampled" the reputation of an NT land council leader, has begun in Darwin.

item.title: Has Australia just killed its cultural cringe?
item.description: How wonderful for Australian writers to receive this recognition from the very people who consume their work, as part of ABC Radio National's Top 100 Books countdown.

item.title: Election campaign donation laws would have blocked $8m in Climate 200 funding
item.description: Climate 200 would have been blocked from making $8.34 million in donations to independent candidates if new election donation laws were in place at the 2025 poll.

item.title: New England voters divided by Barnaby Joyce's flirtation with One Nation
item.description: Support for the politician remains strong in his electorate despite his apparent flirtation with One Nation, a party enjoying a surge in popularity in the seat of New England.

item.title: Space junk found near WA mine linked to Chinese rocket launch
item.description: Suspected space junk which crashed near an iron ore mine in remote WA has been linked to a Chinese rocket launch.

item.title: Bonza's financial backer 777 Partners co-founder charged with fraud
item.description: The FBI investigation resulted in 777 Partners co-founder Joshua Wander being charged with stealing US$500 million from lenders and investors.

item.title: What will happen to the stolen Louvre jewellery? Experts say it is unlikely they will ever be seen again
item.description: Knowing exactly what they were after, four thieves entered the Louvre Museum and successfully stole precious jewellery. Here's what experts say comes next for the historical items.

item.title: Patients at centre of suspected rat poisoning cluster in south-east Queensland are all from Logan. This is what we know
item.description: South-east Queensland authorities are continuing to investigate the source of the cluster, with contact tracing underway.

item.title: Prince Andrew is no longer the Duke of York but will likely remain a prince. Here's why
item.description: The second son of the late Queen Elizabeth II will no longer be called the Duke of York, but he still remains a prince and in the line of succession, despite calls for his remaining title to be stripped. Here's why.

item.title: Temporary bans on fishing popular species floated to address dwindling populations off WA coast
item.description: A temporary ban on fishing iconic species, including WA dhufish and pink snapper, could be on the table as the state government scrambles for solutions to WA's at-risk fish populations.

item.title: Mitch Marsh dismisses suggestion he should open for Australia in the first Ashes Test
item.description: Michael Vaughan wants Mitch Marsh opening the batting for Australia in the Ashes but it would require a serious leap of faith from Test selectors.

item.title: Australian and New Zealand shearers set new world record with 2,301 sheep shorn in eight hours
item.description: A new world record for sheep shearing has been set in southern New South Wales by a team of five shearers who clipped on average a sheep a minute for eight hours straight.

item.title: Fast and easy dinners for busy weeknights
item.description: Make life easier with some of our simplest dinner recipes, including a 15-minute creamy pasta and air-fryer salmon fillets.

item.title: Voter turnout dips again at 2025 WA Local Government elections amid calls for mandatory voting
item.description: The number of West Australians who voted at the weekend's local government elections is slightly down on previous years, following calls for participation to become mandatory.

item.title: Chinese fighter jet released flares 'very close' to Australian aircraft
item.description: Defence Minister Richard Marles says the incident was "unsafe and unprofessional" and the government has made representations to China.

item.title: Work begins on UNSW's billion-dollar Canberra campus in the 'education capital'
item.description: Once complete, the new UNSW campus will be an education hub for thousands of students and staff, and is expected to provide a much-needed injection to the city's economy.

item.title: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr says it has been a 'challenging first year' in minority government
item.description: The ACT's chief minister brushes off criticism that his government is "tired", but acknowledges the 12 months since the election have been "difficult" for the territory.

item.title: Tasmanians buffeted by spring winds, but conditions not unusual, BOM says
item.description: Springtime typically means gardens come to life and the winter chill eases — for Tasmanians, it also means whatever isn't nailed down might get blown away.

item.title: John Simmons was convicted of fraud but no one stopped him being a military advocate who ripped off vulnerable veterans
item.description: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

item.title: The moment authorities move a piece of space junk that crashed in Western Australia.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Scott Pendlebury launches legal action against former financial adviser over alleged secret withdrawals
item.description: The Collingwood player alleges Jason Sourasis, who helmed A-League club Western United before its collapse, misappropriated more than $2 million over a decade.

item.title: Inquest finds death of Mount Barker man waiting for ambulance 'potentially' preventable
item.description: The cardiac arrest death of a man who waited more than 20 minutes for an ambulance could have been "potentially" prevented if a paramedic had not interfered with the dispatch process and had help arrived sooner, a South Australian coroner has found.

item.title: Monday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Amazon cloud unit AWS experiences major global outage disrupting hundreds of platforms
item.description: Amazon's cloud unit AWS has experienced a major global services outage that also disrupted hundreds of other platforms, including Robinhood, Snapchat, Roblox and Perplexity.

item.title: Nashir Hassani forced to pay fine after impersonating security guard at Grand Prix
item.description: Nashir Hassani was fined $4,000 after sneaking into the Formula 1 disguised as a security guard using fake identification and a hi-vis vest.

item.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of detaining scientist ahead of Antarctic conference in Hobart
item.description: A diplomatic row has broken out at an international conservation conference in Hobart after Ukraine accused Russia of detaining one of its scientists for alleged security threats.

item.title: Amazon says outage issue is 'fully mitigated' as sites return to normal— as it happened
item.description: Amazon's cloud unit AWS experienced an outage that also disrupted several other global platforms, affecting customers worldwide — as it happened.

item.title: Coroner probes death of Alice Springs psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated
item.description: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

item.title: Colombia recalls ambassador to the US after Trump announces tariffs increase
item.description: The Colombian foreign ministry said Daniel García-Peña had returned to Bogotá from Washington DC after Donald Trump also announced the US would slash financial assistance to the country.

item.title: Live updates: Albanese and Trump ink critical minerals deal as president tells Rudd: 'I don't like you'
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump have signed a landmark critical minerals deal during a meeting at the White House which included the US president sharing his blunt assessment of Australia's ambassador to the US. Follow live.

item.title: Prince Andrew, Harry, Meghan and King Edward VIII show what losing a title says about the House of Windsor
item.description: Superstar royal biographer Andrew Morton on Prince Andrew, royal scandals and the huge hole Harry and Meghan have left in the monarchy.

item.title: IN FULL: Albanese-Trump meeting at White House
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australians turning to ChatGPT and other AI for financial advice warned to tread with caution
item.description: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

item.title: How bankers have learned to operate outside the rules in the murky world of private credit
item.description: In recent months, there's been a growing focus on private credit, the alter ego of private equity, and the potential it may have to destabilise the system.

item.title: Trump praises Australia and takes swipe at Rudd during White House meeting with Albanese
item.description: Donald Trump lavishes praise on Australia and Anthony Albanese during the pair's landmark meeting in Washington, but takes a swipe at a former prime minister in the room.

item.title: 'Accidental' homeschooling on the rise, as families say schools are not coping
item.description: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

item.title: Destructive winds, storms and record heat to blast south-east Australia in wild weather
item.description: From record October heat to dangerous thunderstorms and gale force winds, the next 36 hours could bring extreme weather across south-east Australia.

item.title: Highlights of Trump-Albanese meeting at White House
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Weapons maker Saab 'directly linked' to human rights harm over missile at Lake Hart
item.description: Traditional owners win a decision against a multinational weapons manufacturer after finding one of the company's missiles at a heritage site in the remote South Australian outback.

item.title: US steps up diplomacy as Israeli strikes test Gaza ceasefire
item.description: US officials travel to Israel as new strikes threaten to unravel progress towards achieving peace in Gaza.

item.title: Surprise exhibition at Hamilton Art Gallery celebrates Hamish Elsmann
item.description: A country Victorian art gallery has surprised local artist Hamish Elsmann with an exhibition of work he never knew it was keeping. The community response has changed his life.

item.title: McLaren not panicking about defending F1 champion Max Verstappen's resurgence
item.description: McLaren boss Andrea Stella says the Formula 1 drivers' championship is still in his team's hands despite Max Verstappen's dominant performance at the US Grand Prix.

item.title: Independent distributors calling for action on perceived monopoly on remote food distribution
item.description: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

item.title: Leo Sayer leads fight against proposed Berrima Gaol redevelopment
item.description: Leo Sayer leads the fight against plans to transform a historic former jail into an upmarket accommodation and hospitality venue in the NSW Southern Highlands.

item.title: Severe heatwave warning with Birdsville tipped to reach 46 degrees
item.description: A severe heatwave warning is in place for parts of western Queensland with Birdsville poised to tip the record for the hottest October day.

item.title: CSIRO voyage discovers new species of shark and crabs off West Australia's Gascoyne coast
item.description: When most people think of sharks, they picture large and dangerous predators. But a new species has been discovered that is only the size of a ruler.

item.title: 'Gammon' assistant minister roles charge NT taxpayers thousands on travel
item.description: Northern Territory government backbenchers charge taxpayers thousands of dollars in travel as "assistant ministers", a role not officially recognised by the parliament.

item.title: Man, 45, charged with murder following Darling Downs man's suspicious disappearance
item.description: A 45-year-old has been charged with murder following the suspicious death of a 48-year-old man who disappeared two weeks ago.

item.title: Natural Spoonfuls creator Stacey Hatfield dies after homebirth complication
item.description: Stacey Hatfield's husband revealed the nutritionist and social media influencer died in September after giving birth to the couple's first child.

item.title: Markets live updates: Critical minerals stocks rally on US deal, miners lift ASX, Amazon Web Services suffers outage
item.description: Critical minerals stocks rally in ASX trade after US and Australian leaders Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese sign an investment deal. Plus, Amazon suffers a mega-internet outage. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Forgotten skate parks leaving the NT behind may be key in preventing crime
item.description: Outdated and forgotten skate parks in the NT forced skaters to build their own underground spot. After years of neglect, experts ask why a region struggling with youth crime can't maintain one of the simplest crime prevention tools there is.

item.title: Sri Lanka scores World Cup win over Bangladesh following stunning final over
item.description: Sri Lanka remains a chance of progressing in the Women's Cricket World Cup, but Bangladesh is out after an extraordinary finish in Navi Mumbai.

item.title: Vocalist Samara Joy is taking the jazz world by storm and she's bringing some new music to Australia
item.description: Samara Joy has been compared to singers like Ella Fitzgerald and Sarah Vaughan. She's performing in Australia for the first time and bringing some new music.

item.title: WA government asks EPA to investigate water taken from Pilbara aquifer
item.description: Traditional owners and pastoralists in WA's Pilbara are hoping a government-ordered review into the usage of a significant aquifer will better protect it.

item.title: Two West Australians in draft for first US women's professional baseball league in decades
item.description: Two West Australians are on the cusp of making history as professional women's baseball returns to the US after a 70-year hiatus.

item.title: SA government hopes selling generators can recoup costs of scrapped hydrogen plant
item.description: South Australian taxpayers are set to pay more than $250 million on generators for the scrapped hydrogen plant — but the state government says it is in an "excellent position" to recoup the costs.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns announces 'in principle' $190m deal to take over Northern Beaches Hospital
item.description: Premier Chris Minns said the government has reached a $190 million deal to takeover the fledgling hospital.

item.title: Strawberry supplies expected to return to normal after weather extremes
item.description: Queensland strawberry growers are finishing their season early due to hot weather, while cold temperatures have delayed ripening in the south.

item.title: Political donations for Tasmania's federal election candidates disclosed in AEC returns
item.description: A $100,000 donation from a sole donor was one of 212 declared by anti-salmon campaigner Peter George in his federal politics tilt, newly released Australian Electoral Commission returns show.

item.title: Moment Trump takes swipe at Rudd
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Legendary WS Cox Plate winner So You Think dies
item.description: A 10-time Group 1 winner, So You Think – who claimed back-to-back WS Cox Plate victories – is remembered as one of greatest race horses hit the turf in Australia.

item.title: Penola's Saint Mary MacKillop inspires new generation 15 years after canonisation
item.description: Australia's first saint faced challenges head-on and paved the way for modern pilgrims from a tiny school in rural South Australia, a nun says.

item.title: Former NFL running back Doug Martin dies after struggle with police
item.description: Police say former Tampa Bay running back Doug Martin died after an attempted detainment following reports of a break-in.

item.title: The Mona Lisa, a gold toilet and now the Louvre's royal jewels: a fascinating history of art heists
item.description: This latest heist at the Louvre highlights the vulnerability of objects in public collections. The irony is they are often gifted to such institutions for safekeeping.

item.title: More accommodation desperately needed in Rockhampton and Yeppoon before 2032 Olympic Games
item.description: More than half of Queensland has rental vacancy rates of less than 1 per cent, and experts say closed and abandoned properties may be the solution — especially with the 2032 Olympic Games looming.

item.title: Trump tells Rudd 'I don't like you', reportedly offers forgiveness off-camera
item.description: President Donald Trump has told Australia's ambassador to the US, Kevin Rudd, "I don't like you, and I probably never will" during a meeting with Anthony Albanese at the White House.

item.title: How the genre of agricultural livestock art became so popular
item.description: An oil painting of an enormous cow is the star attraction at a regional Australian gallery. How did the genre of massive livestock art become so popular?
